page.title: 05Kyle&Carrick Tourist Board.
page.content: Ayr Tourist Board was established in 1982 in conjunction with Scottish Board, District and Regional Councils to promote Ayr as a{tourist centre. Ayr caters for one and a half million staying guests per year. People are attracted to Ayr through its connections with{Rabbie {Burns,}its excellent{golfing facilities,{horse racing}and the beautiful surrounding country. The bucket and spade holidays of the past no longer bring in tourists but the beach is still popular with trippers. The pattern of holidays is changing, people now visit Ayr as part of a general tour of Scotland. Foreign visitors are mostly North American which underlines the importance of {Prestwick Airport.} If Ayr is to expand its tourist trade massive funding is required for facilities.
